com.energyhub.interview.setgame

Class CardFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.energyhub.interview.setgame.CardFactory

  • public class CardFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    CardFactory class

    Simple static-method factory for creating cards. Could be extended to encode an actual deck from which to draw from.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CardFactory

        public CardFactory()

    • Method Detail

      • initializeCardFactory

        public static void initializeCardFactory(java.lang.String filename)
        Initializes the card factory. Caller passes the name or path to a file. The file contains a list of filenames or paths, one per line. Each of those files encodes a descriptor 'type', and the file contains a list of descriptors. For each line in the filename, a call to readDescriptorFile is made, which populates the descriptorMap with descriptor types and their values.
        Parameters:
        filename - name of the input file containing descriptor files.

      • readDescriptorFile

        public static void readDescriptorFile(java.lang.String filename)
        Function to populate the descriptor list map with descriptors. The file should contain one descriptor per line. Each line is encoded into a string an added to an ArrayList. The ArrayList is inserted into the descriptorMap with the name of the file (with any path and file extension information removed) as its key
        Parameters:
        filename - name of the file containing descriptors corresponding to that 'type' of descriptor.

      • drawCard

        public static Card drawCard()
        Draws a random card
        Returns:
        A card constructed with random descriptors, one descriptor from each 'type' of descriptor.

      • getDescriptorKeySet

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getDescriptorKeySet()
        Returns the keyset of the descriptorMap. Which is to say, it returns the set containing all 'types' of descriptors.
        Returns:
        Set objects containing all descriptor 'types' in the descriptor map.

      • getDescriptorList

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getDescriptorList(java.lang.String key)
        Returns a List, containing all descriptors in the descriptorMap, that correspondings to the passed key parameter.
        Parameters:
        key - String describing the key or 'type' of descriptor wanted.
        Returns:
        List containing all descriptors for the key 'type' descriptor; null if key does not exist in descriptor map.

      • clear

        public static void clear()
        Clears the descriptorMap. Used exclusively in testing purposes.
